website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few issues, this duo is capable of tackling nearly every job on your list from contractor work to do-it-yourself projects.
pros: Stands out for offering 2 rugged power tools by a top name in the industry
20-volt impact and drill drivers built to tackle tough jobs
Comes with 2 batteries, charger, and carrying bag
cons: Some battery issues have been documented – failure to hold charge, dead batteries upon arrival
A few complaints of loose chucks and of drills "smelling hot" during use

customer_reviews.title: Pay Attention:  a 20 Volt DeWalt tool is the Terminator in the Cordless Power tools world!
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with thinking you'll save some money by buying some low budget 18-Volt tools... The 20 Volt DeWalt tools are like having a NASCAR, and everything else is just a Prius... Bought this set for my 23 yr old Grandson. Me, I build Movie Sets (for over 35 years), and I'm frequently on Location out in the middle of nowhere; so I have a full collection for myself. Note: 20 Volt DeWalt is the ONLY Brand you'll ever see on a Film Crew Set.
customer_reviews.author: THX1138

customer_reviews.title: New batteries don't last.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing entry from Dewalt. I bought this to replace the older set I had and the lighter lithium batteries looked appealing. Problem is, these things don't last. I would get hours of use out of my old set. For a big project I could go all day on one battery. These last less than an hour on a full charge. Very disappointing. Every project takes twice as long because we have to keep charging the batteries. Two stars because when its fully charged, the tools work fine. If you're looking for something to hang a set of curtains or a picture on the wall, this will work fine. If you are somebody that uses your tools frequently, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: Fan of dewalt but this set didn't cut it sparks flying out the back and a kick when you let off trigger . Just pay a little more and go brushless smoother and no sparks . I work around flmaables at times and this definitely what you don't want is sparks flying out the breather vents
customer_reviews.author: Mr BMB

customer_reviews.title: So HAPPY with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I would have bought them a long time ago if I knew how powerful these drills are! I have built many things with them, and they have never disappointed. I didn't experience any fatigue from using the drills for long periods like I have experienced working with other drills. I own several expensive brand drills, but find that I always reach for the Dewalt. The Batteries last for a very long time & they charge up fast. The drills are easy to use, and are very powerful drill set. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Revital Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: The drill is awful
customer_reviews.text: The Impact is great. The drill is awful. Dewalt put ribs on the chuck and if you are like me you grab the chuck while hitting the trigger to tighten the drill bit in there. it is very painful and you can never get it tight enough to hold the bit , and yes like the other reviews it will fall out. Get the impact by itself and get a better drill with a smooth chuck
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Just received
customer_reviews.text: I have just received the combo, apparently well made, liteweight, battery charged in about 1 hour. The only thing is i only received one belt clip, the other one is missing according to pictures. Noticeable power compared to my old 12v. I will test for a while and review the note.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Dewalt!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this drill and driver combo for my automotive shop. The batteries are long lasting which is very convenient. They provide enough power to get the job done. My guys can use this working on cars or I can use this just around the office doing fix it jobs. DEWALT is a great brand and I will stick their products. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Foust

customer_reviews.title: Quit after first use
customer_reviews.text: I only had this for a couple of weeks and only drilled 4 holes in thin sheet metal. The drilll quit working. It makes noise the light comes on but nothing turns. The impact driver turns on but I didn’t get a chance to use it. Both batteries work in the impact driver so that’s not the issue. No clue why the drill quit. Return being processed.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: A light duty drill !!!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re wondering why this combo is $139 and the other combo is $269, let me assure you there is a huge difference. First time I used the drill the selector would move from drill to a number and start ratcheting. I had to hold the selector to avoid this. Smoke came out of the vent holes. This is not the Dewalt quality tool that I’ve used for decades. With the price, I should have known. I returned it and got the higher priced combo.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Addington

customer_reviews.title: Get em!
customer_reviews.text: I've used DeWalt drills for many years. These are not the 24v and don't have the battery life indicators. That said,they are perfect for around the house. The impact I've used for decks and I haven't used another product that even comes close in power and durability. The battery life is good and these drills have never let me down! The price point is spot on. Get em!
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: Chuck will not hold drill bits.
customer_reviews.text: The chuck will not hold drill bits. It's good for the first two or three drillings, then the drill bit just slips out of the chuck. I've never seen anything like it. Everything else is fine, but when you're two storeys up a ladder and the damn drill bit drops to the ground, it doesn't do any good to have a drill that has torque, power, and battery life WHEN THE DAMN BIT'S 20 FEET BELOW YOU IN THE WEEDS!
customer_reviews.author: gatorboy

customer_reviews.title: Light on the end is helpful
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these for my shop class. I would do it again in a heartbeat. Not only do my students treat these drills/ impacts with more respect because of the brand, they are simple to use and have a helpful light on the end to allow students to see more clearly. I also love the chargers and bags that come with them as they are also of extremely high quality. They also have been used a ton in the year since I purchased them and they show no signs of wear and tear despite how often they are used.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal compared to Impact Driver Alone
customer_reviews.text: I was going to get just the driver - but when realized the impact tool came with just one battery, I figured that getting this combination would get me the second battery and a VSR drill at a price I couldn't beat. In this particular package, the tools were assembled in Mexico and the batteries were assembled in Japan. Bag and charger came from China. Everything works superbly - and that driver is absolutely wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky ColonelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, items look nice. Batteries are junk. Charged both according to instructions, both showed fully charged. Bought them to replace an old Kawasaki I had, but the Dewalt wouldn't even allow me to complete one pilot hole before both batteries died. Recharged batteries again, almost completed one pilot with 4 batteries. Ended up borrowing someone's battery and charger from their Dewalt and the drill worked fine. I was able to complete my project using his battery. I don't recommend purchasing this as you will need to buy new batteries to replace the ones it comes with, despite the whole kit being brand new. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: quality from dewalt
customer_reviews.text: amazing price for the set..and that driver/impact is amazing.. I did my breaks the other day, front rotors and pads, for fun. I only used the gun and wwd40... it takes every bolt and lug off with ease... things amazing. and the drill is another quality dewalt item. both are.. this set was like 130 on prime. the impact gun alone is worth 140... it's like an amazing drill was thrown in for free... if you need new drills. buy these, I've used either or everyday, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Item defective
customer_reviews.text: I used the drill to make a couple of holes like 4 of them. Made 1 and the battery died out on the next hole. I swapped out the battery and the second battery lasted a little longer like 5 minutes. And the batteries were fully charged. That's good that I took my old drills to finish the job. Dewalt should not even sell these batteries. Don't waste your money on this unless you know your planning to upgrade the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: mirta

customer_reviews.title: If Dewalt is your preference, this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Just as described. Good quality, timely delivery. I'm very pleased with this product. Not particularly a fan of the bag would have preferred a hard case but that's just personal preference. Future buyers enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Bourneenvy78

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Overall dewalt is a good quality brand in my opinion. My batteries charge fine and the drill is fine, but the impact driver seems highly defective. Everytime I use it (or try to at least) it has next to no power behind the motor even with a fully charged battery. To make it worse it emits a horrible electrical burning smell.. I don't to return the whole thing because I'd really just like to replace the impact driver. Cant figure out how to get in touch with the seller so hopefully they see this. If not I'll be returning the whole set.
customer_reviews.author: Conner

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are going to need a good charging.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this product. I bought the 20 volt to replace the old 18 volt that I have been using with complete satisfaction until last week. After throwing a fit about the impact/driver I tried to recharge the battery and had luck. Working just as good or better that the old 18 volt impact/driver that I had before. The charger isn't as good as the charger for the 18 volt system. Must pay careful attention to how the battery sits in/on the charger. This may do the job that I wanted done.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tool did not Function properly and to expectation and satisfaction of the customer.
customer_reviews.text: I started drilling a 1/2" hole in aboard yesterday in a 2" thick piece of wood and the drill keeps loosening up and falling out. Then the drill starts smoking and sounding like sparking inside, so I stopped using it. Very upset that a brand new tool acted like that by just drilling through pine boards. I thought DeWalt was a Name Brand Tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey E White

customer_reviews.title: Beware of reliability and quality
customer_reviews.text: Giving a one star to rate. The same issue as when purchased. 2nd product from Christmas. The Chuck loosens up and clunks and releases the drill bit.
customer_reviews.author: fisher

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform
customer_reviews.text: I received these as promised, when I tested them after trying to charge the batteries these did not perform. The driver kept getting stuck and would quit halfway through a 3” screw. Something that my Ryobi driver took care of without any issues. Would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Tobar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to replace my 10+ year-old Milwaukee drill and this is a great set! I don't need it for my daily job or anything, just some DIY stuff here and there. I mounted my tv to the wall this weekend and used the impact to drive the bolts into the wall and it did it effortlessly. I'm not sure how it compared to newer models of Milwaukee or other competitors but I'm happy with it so it's worth the money to me.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Torque Beast
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many Dewalt products and still have and use them daily. I am happy with the drill, but the driver has no provision to hold a spare or other drive bits. I would preferred a bit holder over the belt clip. Also there’s no adjustment to the torque settings. So I am finding smaller screws are easily stripped or snapped off. This tool has one purpose and that’s driving construction screws when you need all this torque.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonia 113

customer_reviews.title: Impact driver isn't heavy duty (at all.)
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 6 months & generally happy.. But - the chuck on the impact driver failed (there are repair videos all over the internet for how to fix it - although the fix doesn't quite work.) Bad design. Also, the impact driver smells like ozone when I use it - ie smells like a burning motor - even when it's just turning freely with no resistance. Not inspiring confidence there ...
customer_reviews.author: DaveU

customer_reviews.title: Great set and great battery life even with the smaller batteries
customer_reviews.text: The drill and impact driver both work flawlessly and battery life has been great. Those little batteries seem to last forever. Used them (both) to build a swingset which took hours to assemble and neither seemed low on battery and were going as strong as when the batteries were taken off the chargers. I was amazed that those little batteries last that long.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Batteries (might as well) not included
customer_reviews.text: The drills are just fine but the batteries that came with it are worthless. I had dewalt 18 volt batteries that lasted me about 7 years in harsh conditions (infrequent use, leaving it on the charger, multiple freeze cycles) but these didn't hold a charge or deliver any power from the day I got it. I made due with some 2 amp batteries that I got with a graco handheld sprayer but I loaned that to a friend this week and now struggle to do anything with my drills. It was a good deal but I wish I didn't have to spend another $100 for a pair of decent batteries for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mullikin

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the batteries that came with this package. Batteries do not last long. Suppose I will look for, and have to buy larger batteries, ( I do hope that they have a larger battery ) that has a longer useful operating time. I have had the 18 Volt Dewalt drill for many years and the (larger) batteries that I use with it usually have enough charge to last between the 45 minute charge times.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Rosamond

customer_reviews.title: Love these tools
customer_reviews.text: I love these tools was not sure if I would like the impact driver. It is great. Light weight and powerful. Would buy again. Have used them to drive 31/2 inch deck screws. They handled it with ease. as i have continued to use these tools they continue to amaze me with long battery life and power i had nicad battery drills before, these are much lighter and more powerful and the battery life is much better. drove 88 3 inch tapcon screws with the impact driver and a single battery. love this set.
customer_reviews.author: Alex c

customer_reviews.title: My dad loves them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for my dad to replace his 20 year old DeWalt drills. He loves them. The batteries charge super fast and they are a lot lighter than the old style even with the battery attached. He's been using them nonstop since he got them and no problems so far. Fingers crossed these will last 20 years like the last ones.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy with those.  Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Got this kit and extra 5600mah batteries non OEM. I love Dewalt, always wanted those but didn’t want to spend the money. Well, they’re worth every penny. And they’re made to last. My neighbor makes lockers for gyms, he treats his tools like trash, and had everything. Said DeWalt is absolutely the best. Never breaks down.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Porsche

customer_reviews.title: Good Driver Set.
customer_reviews.text: I like the convenience of a battery operated unit. I was disappointed with the impact driver because it didn’t have the power to break free the first nut I tried it on. That is unfair, because that nut was so badly rusted in place that, when I used a manual wrench, I twisted the bolt off. DeWalt is a good product with long lasting and quick charging batteries. Both of these drivers feel lighter than other units I own. They come in a convenient and strong canvas carrying case. I strongly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: hande64

customer_reviews.title: The drills are great, but buy an extra battery.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift to myself! The drills themselves are both great, but the batteries leave much to be desired. My batteries last 3-4 hours, depending on what I am doing. Buying an extra battery (in addition to the 2 included) wouldn't hurt. However as I said, the drills are both good quality and meaty enough for big projects or dense/hard woods, my only complaint is the battery life being too short for my tastes. In the future I plan to upgrade to brushless drills, especially since I plan on using these for big projects or commercial work. However they are perfect for projects around the house or garage.
customer_reviews.author: Gary & Kalah

customer_reviews.title: No hassle return policy from a quality company
customer_reviews.text: Great DeWalt tools, arrived promptly, well packaged and good quality. Unfortunately I had a defective battery, but the returns policy was quick and easy and had a whole replacement within 36 hours. The driver and drill are light and easy to use and the torque is good for such small units with 1.3 AH batteries. If you were undertaking major work requiring constant use you may need larger battery packs. I completed my utility room dry wall install on one charge and both units were brilliant. Love the tool bag to store these in also.
customer_reviews.author: Moonraker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful upgrade from a standard drill
customer_reviews.text: I am a home DIYer and I've used just a cheap craftsman combo drill for years, but finally decided to upgrade as I do more projects. I love the impact driver's quick release/install for bits. You can swap out the bit with one hand, which is not something I could do with the old drill. Both are lightweight and ergonomic to hold and use. Would definitely recommend buying a second battery so you can use the drill and driver simultaneously without needed to switch the battery out between them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Wow! It is phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a small lightweight B&D hand drill for years and loved it. But recently, it's been acting up - intermittent trigger. I checked the deals and finally decided to bypass the low priced cordless hand drills and treat myself to the DeWalt. Wow! It is phenomenal! Great ergonomics. Love the built in light! Changing battery easy peasy. Torque setting to keep from stripping screws. Not as small or handy as my B&D but I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Siefker

customer_reviews.title: Just upgrade from the chunky 18V already!
customer_reviews.text: Great set. The pistol grip on these feels great in the hand. Much much lighter than the 18v style ones from years past. Lithium batteries have power right up to the end and youll know as midway thru driving a screw it slows to a crawl and dies. No biggie pop the other battery on and go. By the time that one dies the old ones charged. The 1/4" impact i didnt think id use that much but its so handy once you have it! The LED lights in both make it nice in those dark areas.
customer_reviews.author: Mrguy

customer_reviews.title: My go to tool for everyday auto repairs & carpentry work
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for everyday chores and repair work. Makes deck work and automotive repair much quicker. I love the impact tool, makes removing rusted fasteners easy. Purchased assorted socket extenders and metric sockets. My every day go to tool. Long lasting 20v batterys get the job done without constantly charging. No need to use pneumatic impact wrench with long air hose dragging behind you any more.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: These have great power and battery life and are easy to use. My only complaint is the drill only has one light below the chuck which gets blocked when drilling. The driver is designed with three lights so has great visibility. The bag has extra space in it which is helpful for storing but sets and an extra tool or two
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use. About onr hour battery life on wrach battery. The driver is AWESOME. Thought the batteries were faulty at first, then read lots of pweoplee have had similar problems and it is due to the charging unit giving a false impression. The batteries need to click into place. The light comes on when they are placed in the charger and so I thought they were charging. They were not. Not untill you hear/ feel that click. Then they charge fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lsee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful drill, easy for a petite woman to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill. The battery charged fast and the drill has so much power. We have an 18v drill that is larger than this one and the battery is going bad, plus it’s hard for me to hold up due to its size. This one is a little heavy but not too bad. It’s much easier for me to handle for all my little projects. I also like the carrying case it came with. I don’t know what an impact drill does but I’ll figure it out I’m sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Palomino

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Tried really hard to love them but they are heavy and the motor is gummy. My m12 Milwaukee setup can do more work than this setup. It has its place, I'd say this is a great set for demo work. But for light framing and drywall I'd go with something more precise.
customer_reviews.author: mark moore

customer_reviews.title: Battery/Battery Charger is Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this drill and compact combo for my dad, when it arrived he loved it. Said it was the perfect size and would make him finish his jobs faster. The batteries came pre-charged, yesterday he put it on to charge and it just would not change. The red light comes on on their battery charge and that's it. He left it on the charger for a few hours and it still did not charge. I need an answer from someone about this issue, I'm not sure if it's the battery or the battery charger. I'm very disappointed about the product
customer_reviews.author: Anika K

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when ordering, my iPad shows I’d be getting the drill set, bit set & Torq set WITH my Oder, not an add on for extra $$. Spoke with customer care & they said they’d inform web designers to separate the “additional options”. Not as advertised. w/ Extra 5 Amp Hour Battery Drill/Impact Kit w/ 21 pc. Drill Bit Set w/40-Piece FlexTorq Screw Driving Set Combo kit w/ 45-pc. bit set Drill Driver/ Impact Combo Kit w/ USB Power Source
customer_reviews.author: Theresa P.

customer_reviews.title: These are junk!
customer_reviews.text: I saw that the combo kit was on sale for $150, and I decided to give them a shot. Unfortunately, I revived the combo kit bag containing only the drill, one battery, and the charger. I thought “Okay well, I’ll at least try the drill to see if it’s any good before I return it.” Immediately after I put the battery in and spun it for the first time, it was sparking excessively and had a strong odor of burning plastic accompanied with a little bit of smoke. I don’t understand how this passed quality control, and I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: battery does not last long+locking mechanism does not hold when unscrewing the pre-drill holes
customer_reviews.text: power on both battery last less then a box of 350 screws for the deck. Had to recharge one while other is being used for pre-drilling holes for 8x3 screws or 8x1 5/8. Also when you reverse the drill bit out, it will come loose cause us to break about 6 drill bits. Very disappointed. Should have bought another brand. Don't cross your finger about the drill bit cause it was a known issue. We were just hoping it would not happen to us.
customer_reviews.author: anh2

customer_reviews.title: The perfect cordless Drills.
customer_reviews.text: I love these cordless drills. I mainly bought the set because I just needed to be able to get around in smaller areas without dragging a cord around like my old faithful drill. These just work so great. They are so light, have a lot of power and used one on and off all day long without the battery out. I love Dewalt tools anyway and I am so glad I bought these. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: R. Evans

customer_reviews.title: I just bought this product a month ago I tried ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this product a month ago I tried to use with that today and find out the drill not working right, I charged the battery but it’s not even working one minute . It’s going empty fast..
customer_reviews.author: AA Tesema

customer_reviews.title: Much lighter than previous models
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a burnt out drill and didn't think I needed an impact driver, but the price of this combined package was too good a deal. I LOVE the impact driver - so much lighter and ergonomic than using a drill and it does a much better job. Batteries are small and light, tools of good quality. Too bad the batteries aren't compatible with older Dewalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Cheff Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Suck!
customer_reviews.text: The setup works pretty well. My main gripe is the batteries that come in this kit are junk. Be prepared to recharge them constantly. Since none of their kits come with larger batteries, you're stuck with 2 worthless ones you got at a package discount and then have to purchase another decent one at fully inflated price. Great for the small around the house type mini projects, but worthless if you're looking for extended use or wall electrical work(hole saw, paddle bit) due to the short battery life. I'll now be shelling out a large chunk for larger batteries I had not planned to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for the stuff I do around the house. Battery last long enough to do the things I want to do and has enough power. Wouldn't recommend for construction. But perfect for your everyday around the house needs
customer_reviews.author: robroy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Although I've had this for less than a year, I have no complaints about how it works. Both items work great, the battery life is great and it is also fast charging. My only problem is that I have to get another charger because on the first use, I plugged it into 220v current (in the caribbean we mostly use 220 and can only get 110 by using a transformer). Otherwise, everything works.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: This price is nuts! Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This set is awesome!! If you bought both of these individually and two batteries and a charger it would be almost triple this price and you still wouldn’t get the bag or comes with. I use both of these for home projects constantly. Great power and torque. Battery life is great. Dewalt is one of the best brands out there and getting both of these with all of the extras at this price is a no brainer. If you think you’ll use it, buy it. It will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Are a Deal Breaker
customer_reviews.text: The 1.3 amp hour batteries that these tools come with are absolutely useless after just a few screws. I was helping a friend build a deck and I didn't even get 5 minutes in driving screws before these things were absolutely dead. Maybe if you just need them to hang the odd picture or something these would be okay, but at that point why are you spending so much on dewalt? Don't buy this package unless you're willing to spend more getting bigger batteries. Shame on dewalt for offering this crappy deal.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah Brattin

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It's DeWalt. It's what I expected. If you're not expecting or needing brushless technology, then you can get some reasonably good deals. And if you're just a hobby wood worker like me, the old technology works perfectly fine. I still have my 25 year old corded DeWalt drill and I still use it. In fact i still have my Black and Decker 3/8 inch drill I bought in 1972.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Drill Meets the expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro but i can do things with a drill i always buy tool and and try to make sure that i get the most use out of it. Here what i think about this drill its expensive and the quality of the drill is goods and make for a great addition to a tool collection. If you are okay with spending the money the quality is definitely there. But you can get the same results with much cheaper options and if your not a person that uses a drill often then just get a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: DAPPER DAD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic upgrade from my heavy bulky old drill. They require minimal effort so no fatigue. I have small hands and these are very comfortable to hold and use. I started with cheaper porter cable tools and have slowly been upgrading and these are definitely worth the price tag. The bag was a really nice addition too.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I May Have Got a Dud
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this drill set because it was a good price and I own a lot of Dewalt tools that I love. I will say it may be just my experience with this model. The DCD771 had a major issue for me and when I had it in setting two the chuck would release the bit. It was such an issue I returned it, and I bit the bullet and upgraded to the 996 and I’m very happy with that drill. The 885 also had an issue where when it heated up it smelled really bad, I returned the kit so in the other kit I got an 887, which feels the same minus the smell.
customer_reviews.author: The Dire Maker

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Work or Home
customer_reviews.text: Stays with me in the work truck. This is the must have starter set to working with Dewalt 20volt tools. We upgraded all of our power tools from 18v to 20 volt for the power increase, and most of all better batteries. The batteries are lighter and more powerful. They are lasting longer as well in terms of lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Bart M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the 18-volt drill set for about 5 years. When I moved to this 20 volt pair of drills, it was night and day. I am a handyman and do a lot of installation around the apartment complex units and auto mechanics as a hobby. These drills are definitely worth their weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Kunai K.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: Very good and rugged set. Used both tools for roughly 9 hours off and on and both batteries were still going even I was done. The impact drill was great for running screws through metal. The drill is a little heavy, but that is more than compensated by its power and long battery life. 5/5 would recommend this set to the average backyard builder or construction starter.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great combo set
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this set for years. I also have a set of the Hitachi brand. The DeWalt set provides better performance for use on construction. Battery life is good and they charge quickly. I see quite a few lower ratings on here but it looks like some people are using them to torque lug bolts These are not made for that purpose. These are more appropriate for wood working and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt is a superior product.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cordless drill and impala set. I'm an Industrial Maintenance Mechanic. Our manager switched from Dewalt to Milwaukee. In my experience Dewalt is a superior product. Dewalt has better torque, battery time, battery life. Dewalt is superior in durability as well. As far as cordless products go. I suggest Dewalt hands down.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: There ok for home chores not bad
customer_reviews.text: They are ok to start off first time buying this brand , so far the 1/2 drill smelled like something was burning I don’t know if it was because it was new but the other one did a good job did not have a smell besides new
customer_reviews.author: Chuy Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Non Functioning
customer_reviews.text: Drill arrived and didn't work. Ensured battery was fully charged. Lights came on but drill didn't move. Returning and very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: CD0726

customer_reviews.title: I'm screwing everything up!
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt is DeWalt. Great company great product. I bought this for me and my husband. I use the impact because it's awesome, light weight and easy to use. Super easy to switch out bits if needed. My husband took the other drill because he's always liked those kind. Not our first DeWalt drill won't be the last.
customer_reviews.author: kellystewart2005

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box I used this set to do some projects around the house, and then I built an axe throwing range. Both the drill and the driver performed very well, and I love how light and compact they are. I got this set to replace an older Skill driver/drill, so it was a pretty low bar, but I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R Link

customer_reviews.title: Early review
customer_reviews.text: Just received my order and want to make a couple "so far" comments. First I was disappointed the impact driver is not "made in USA " as shown in the photos. Clearly marked made in Mexico. It Is very important to support American workers if at all possible. As noted in another persons review, both these tools have a "smell" to them when in use. This is especially true of the drill/driver along with sparks visible inside the housing? Use will tell if this purchase was a good deal or not.
customer_reviews.author: Old Hooker

customer_reviews.title: Advertising was misleading.
customer_reviews.text: I love these Dewalt drills and this is my second set. Little annoyed because when I searched this item it was displayed with a set of bits and drivers. None of that accompanied the purchase. It was one of the key reasons that I purchased through Amazon and not my local Lowes store. I'm sure the drills are going to be fine... but the other issue is misleading and annoying. And I looked at it several times before hitting "add to cart!"
customer_reviews.author: John Roberts

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade for older models
customer_reviews.text: Had this kit for around 10 months and it has held up very well. This replaced my old Craftsman kit that was 10 years old. What a difference! Battery life is great, with one battery lasting me a full 12 hour day of building shelves for the garage. The only suggestion for Dewalt would be to change the location of the LEDs on the drill. There is a shadow right where the drill tip contacts the surface.
customer_reviews.author: jp be me

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT 20V MAX Cordless Drill Combo Kit, 2-Tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm a DIY'er, I do almost all my own repairs, these 2 tools help me save time, I still have my 18v drills, these are lighter but stronger, i use a lot of the impact driver tools, screwdrivers/nut driver, I like that the attachments lock in, don't fall out, to me Dewalt is the best tool
customer_reviews.author: Flowers Cove

customer_reviews.title: Burning smell
customer_reviews.text: Just finally got a chance to use the smaller impact driver and it makes an awful burning smell and sparks on the inside when you let off the trigger! The bigger one sparks on the inside when you let off the trigger also, that can’t be normal
customer_reviews.author: Krystalynn Stiern

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Craftsman
customer_reviews.text: Words cannot express how disappointed I am in the drill and batteries in this set. I gave my 8 year old Hitachi to my sister and replaced it with this set (after much research I might say). I am an avid DIY’er, but far from a contractor. The driver works well and has amazing torque, but the battery life and keyless chuck on the drill pale in comparison to my old hitachi (even after 8 years of abuse). Drill bit will come loose even drilling through a 2x4. Wish I had the old hitachi back. If you are going to use this drill for more than 10 minutes a year, save yourself the trouble and do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd spend the extra money and have a professional grade drill. Little did I know it would start smoking the fourth time I used it. And, now I find out the DeWalt warranty is virtually worthless. Bring it in, drop it off, and maybe it will be done in 2-3 weeks. So maybe do a quick swap out? No sir, only repairs. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my father-in-law as a gift and he finally approves of me. He may even love me. He hasn't said it yet but maybe one day.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kaysen

customer_reviews.title: The batteries are junk
customer_reviews.text: About the tool kit for the batteries and batteries quit after 3 weeks so I'm basically out the battery switch is what I bought the kit for it to be enough so I'd say don't waste your time it's a rip-off you're going to need to order more batteries in the end either way is some kind of scam to get going and they know know it
customer_reviews.author: Cory D.

customer_reviews.title: It is a good household tools to have for any house project support.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of same tools that I have for my father in law's house. It is same as my current set. Only different was the battery on this set is made in Mexico and my old set that I got 3 years ago. The battery is made in Japan other than this the tools work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: A drill you can count on every time you need to use it
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact I can always count on being able to use this drill and get the job done I do side work I am retired and I use it a lot in what I do I find it very efficient
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Good for general household use
customer_reviews.text: I don't see these being used in heavy-duty scenarios. But these are good enough for just general things around the house. I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Pham

customer_reviews.title: Can't kill them.
customer_reviews.text: I take care of my tools but use them hard. I have used these daily for over a year and have had no problems except that they can hurt you due to the high torque. Batteries have held up to many many charges and are still in great shape and have good runtime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The cordless drill set are powerful and long lasting. I use them Everyday for various projects around the house, love these drills.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Stepping my game up
customer_reviews.text: The design and power is what I most admire about DeWalt tools. Started doing DIY and used Black and Decker, Bosche And Makita and all.had something to desire. This is a great purchase and if you are like me and need a impact as well as Drill awesome investment.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Good drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a replacement for a older drill I had. This has power, is light and very powerful. Now, I'm not a professional but for me, it works great for the projects I work on around the house. The only knock on it is the battery life isn't quite what you need if you are putting up studs. I purchased a 3.0 battery separately and use the 2.0 batteries as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More power
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good drill for the money . I order this for my mechanic. He was going somewhere else to order a drill .. I said hey get it from Amazon!!! I found him this drill !!! He loves it ! He got 2 for the money he was spending on 1 : this one is better quality
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Good drills low life battery. Decent value but set battery expectations low.
customer_reviews.text: Drills work well, they are Dewalt, but not professional grade. Batteries discharge quickly with sustained use. There are batteries of all sizes to buy. That's how they get you. Looking at some Dewalt 20V combo sets now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Fun Guy

customer_reviews.title: Batteries were defective
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if they were stored improperly by Amazon or what it was, however both batteries received a charged, drilled a combination of about 6 holes in 2x4 studs and subsequently died. Would not recommend as the return policy and it's window are so small and insignificant that you'd be better off avoiding this product all together. Hopefully someone reads this and moves on to greener pastures as I just spent 159$ on this and now I will have to spend another 160$ on two more batteries for my father. Save yourself the time and money and find a different item.
customer_reviews.author: jamie brandon stewart

customer_reviews.title: Impact drill smells odd when used
customer_reviews.text: My only concern is that the impact drill smells like that of a dentist drill when I give it full power. The smell is disconcerting, as I feel the motor is apt to burn out. I had it replaced with another drill, but it gives off the same smell. Call to Amazon didn't result in any information as to whether this was normal.
customer_reviews.author: James Arthurs

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!  Much easier to get hubby to work on the to-do list!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. We think it was an excellent value. Comes with two battery packs. It has multiple speeds and a light. The drill is light weight. The bit locks in place. The storage bag is big enough to hold the accessories I purchased. I don’t think he’ll use the driver very often but I think his self confidence has improved since owning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great drills, lousy batteries
customer_reviews.text: I has been over a month and I love the drills, but the batteries suck. I have had 18v dewalt tools for about 15 years and have loved the large batteries. Now they sell these 20v with small batteries and they barely last 15 minutes. So looks like I have to order larger batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second combo set I have purchased this year. Light weight, battery holds charge.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: really disappointed right now
customer_reviews.text: really disappointed right now...one of the batteries does not appear to take a charge.....going to try one more time before returning.......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I got the driver drill combo kit! Great deal! I haven't used them yet but I bought them because we used both to build a deck at our cabin but I didn't have my own set. I am very excited to build my garage shelving this weekend with them!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Kay

customer_reviews.title: great tools
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to replace a 15 year old Dewalt battery powered drill. Everything is smaller, lighter & has more power. The battery seems to last forever. It made quick work (using the impact driver) of removing & replacing the steps to our front deck. Wish I'd done this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.. kind of
customer_reviews.text: Drill broke right away. Problem with the chuck. Not sure what happened. Contacted amazon and they we’re very professional and offered to send a replacement right away. So I’ll come back and change to 5 stars if the new one is in working order. No problems with the impact so far
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne E Conklin

customer_reviews.title: DIY guy: glad to hv bought this set
customer_reviews.text: i’ve had these for over six months. worked on a few diy projects and they hold up good battery power. their light weight makes it so much easier to get things done. was initially debating on buying this set, glad i did. good investment for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: zooop

customer_reviews.title: Must have tools
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe the deal that i got on this. Battery life isnt the best but it's nice having the two batteries. Having an impact driver compared to just a drill is a game changer for anyone that does a lot of DIY projects
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Takes getting used to
customer_reviews.text: My old DeWalt drill did not have the same feel, drive action and battery performance as this one and the impact driver. Depending on the age of the drill you're replacing, you may experience the same. I wanted to return it but was involved in a furniture building project and needed a drill/driver. I kept using it and got used to the way they worked and now I really like them. Some people have mentioned that the bits come loose. You need to tighten the chuck until it clicks and then there are no problems, at least for me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Buhrow

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, powerful, practical tools
customer_reviews.text: Finally had to reluctantly replace my 20-year-old cordless dewalt and settled on these. After putting them through a thorough round of testing, I have to admit these are a definite improvement on the old design. Plenty of power, long battery life, and the rugged durability I expect from a quality tool. All for a surprisingly affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Stunkboy

customer_reviews.title: beast mode
customer_reviews.text: take this review with the caveat of the fact that I was coming from a drill that only had a 9.6V battery. So far, these things have destroyed whatever I have put them up against. The impact driver makes a burning smell when I fire it up. The drill doesn't...go figure. The burning smell isn't enough to dissuade me from thinking these things are awesome. Once again, caveat...but it's like night and day from my old drill. Also, spacious carrying case, two batteries?? wut wut?! just buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J Bonfiglio

customer_reviews.title: Battery terrible
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even had it for a year and both batteries won’t hold a charge. I don’t use it often, just for a few projects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: ANR

product_meta.title: DEWALT 20V MAX Cordless Drill Combo Kit, 2-Tool (DCK240C2)
product_meta.description: Style:Drill Driver/ Impact Combo KitThe DEWALT DCK240C2 20v Lithium Drill Driver/Impact Combo Kit (1.5Ah) is comprised of the DCF885 20V MAX Lithium-Ion 1/4-Inch Impact Driver which is compact (5.55" front to back) and lightweight (2.8 lbs.), designed to fit into tight areas. This unit offers one-handed loading 1/4" hex chuck accepts 1" bit tips, and also features a 3 LED light ring with 20 second delay to provide visibility without shadows. A belt hook is also included for portability on the worksite. The DCD771C2 20V MAX Lithium-Ion Compact Drill/Driver is also compact and lightweight, designed to fit into tight areas. This drill/driver offers a high performance motor that delivers 300 unit watts out (UWO) of power ability, which allows for a wide range of applications. This unit also features a high speed transmission that delivers 2 speeds (0-450 & 1,500 rpm) for a range of fastening and drilling applications. The 1/2" single sleeve ratcheting chuck provides tight bit gripping strength, and the ergonomic handle delivers comfort and control. Both tools are part of the DEWALT 20-Volt MAX system and are compatible with all 20-Volt MAX batteries, chargers and accessories. Includes: (1) DCF885 20v MAX Lithium Impact Driver, and (1) DCD771 20v Max Lithium Drill/Driver, (2) 20-Volt Maximum lithium-ion 1.5Ah battery packs, (1) 20-Volt Maximum charger and contractor bag.
feature_bullets: Ergonomic design: Lightweight tools designed to fit the user’s needs
Increased Visibility: The DCF885 features a built in Led with 20 second delay after trigger release
Includes: (1) DCD771 drill/driver, (1) DCF885 1/4 inches impact driver, (2) 20V Max Lithium Ion 1.3 Ah battery packs, 20 volt max charger, and (1) kit bag
One handed bit loading: The DCF885 has a 1/4 inches hex chuck and accepts 1 inches bit tips, Power Tool type: Cordless
High performance motor: The DCD771 delivers 300 Unit Watts Out (UWO) of power ability completing a wide range of applications

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,969 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
